intro: Memecylon gossweileri, commonly known as the African memecylon, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a waxy coating. The small white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and the fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule.
